009
010package imagingbook.lib.filters;
011
012import imagingbook.lib.image.access.ScalarAccessor;
013
014/**
015 * Generic linear convolution filter implemented
016 * by extending the {@link GenericFilter2D} class.
017 * If applied to a vector-valued image (e.g. an RGB image) this
018 * scalar filter is applied to each component, which is
019 * automatically handled by {@link GenericFilter2D}.
020 * Thus only the scalar version of the filter needs to be defined
021 * (see  {@link #filterScalar(ScalarAccessor, int, int)}).
022 * 
023 * @author WB
024 * @version 2020/12/29
025 */
026public class LinearFilter2D extends GenericFilter2D {
027        
028        private final float[][] H;              // the kernel
029        private final int wH, hH;               // width/height of the kernel
030        private final int xcH, ycH;             // 'hot spot' coordinates
031        
032        /**
033         * The preferred constructor.
034         * @param kernel the 2D filter (convolution) kernel
035         */
036        public LinearFilter2D(Kernel2D kernel) {
037                this.H = kernel.getH();
038                this.wH = kernel.getWidth();
039                this.hH = kernel.getHeight();
040                this.xcH = kernel.getXc();
041                this.ycH = kernel.getYc();
042        }
043        
044        
045        /**
046         * Constructor.
047         * Takes only a 2D filter kernel whose 'hot spot' is assumed to
048         * be at its center.
049         * 
050         * @param H the filter (convolution) kernel
051         * @deprecated
052         */
053        public LinearFilter2D(float[][] H) {
054                this(H, H[0].length/2, H.length/2);
055        }
056        
057        /**
058         * Constructor.
059         * Takes a 2D filter kernel and the associated 'hot spot' 
060         * coordinates.
061         * 
062         * @param H the filter (convolution) kernel
063         * @param HctrX the x-coordinate of the kernel's hot spot
064         * @param HctrY the y-coordinate of the kernel's hot spot
065         * @deprecated
066         */
067        public LinearFilter2D(float[][] H, int HctrX, int HctrY) {
068//              this.kernel = null;
069                this.H = H;
070                this.wH = H.length;
071                this.hH = H[0].length;
072                this.xcH = HctrX;
073                this.ycH = HctrY;
074        }
075        
076
077        
078        // --------------------------------------------------------------
079        
080        @Override
081        protected float filterScalar(ScalarAccessor ia, final int u, final int v) {
082                float sum = 0;
083                for (int j = 0; j < hH; j++) {
084                        int vj = v + j - ycH;
085                        for (int i = 0; i < wH; i++) {
086                                int ui = u + i - xcH;
087                                sum = sum + ia.getVal(ui, vj) * H[i][j];
088                        }
089                }
090                return sum;
091        }
092        
093        // --------------------------------------------------------------
094        
095        /**
096         * Returns the kernel of this filter as a 2D {@code float} array.
097         * Provided for sub-classes who create their own kernel
098         * (e.g., {@link GaussianFilter}).
099         * 
100         * @return the filter kernel (no copy)
101         */
102        public float[][] getKernel() {
103                return this.H;
104        }
105}
